text:
Hi guys, I looked through the documentations but couldn't find answer to my question about widget-data.  It is used in the header to generate dynamic classes `class="header-main__container--{{ widget_data.header_type.value|replace(' ', '-')|lower }}"`
So where is the value "header_type" is located and how to modify it?
You can use GraphQL: check this tutorial -> <https://app.HubSpot.com/academy/4685432/lessons/1155840/47186?language=EN>

Hello, I would like to access variables from a global module in others modules in my templates.

In this global modules, Iâ€™m getting value from a HubDB row like this:
```{% set formation_date_text =  module.hubdbrow_field.columns.date_text %}```
In another module, I want to display this variable like this:
```{{ formation_date_text }}```
This in not working. What is the process to make this happening ?

You'll want to inspect the `all_widgets` field from the Developer Info (you can access it via the HubSpot sprocket at the top right corner of the page).
There you'll find all the modules listed in that page, read the `custom_widget_name` prop of the module you're interested in and then you can get its object like this:
```{{ all_widgets | selectattr('custom_widget_name','equalto','name_of_your_module') | tojson }}```

I am struggling with plus_time filter. I am trying to take a field on our deal object: `template_data.quote.associated_objects.deal.contract_start_date` and add a year: `CONTRACTSTART|plus_time(1, "years")` but it just returns the `CONTRACTSTART` value - not the value + 1 year. Any ideas?

Make sure the date field you're trying to modify is a datetime object.
Other than that I don't know what could be the issue...
thanks Alberto, it is a date picker as the HubSpot field and I am also setting it as a dateformat in hubl
